![](https://i.imgur.com/d7bSzo0.jpg) (C) by pixabay and modified by @detlev for #beersaturday We are week **340 of the BEER and fun challenge** and it is time for you to join the beery fun. Each week we call everyone worldwide to show us some of their favourite beer and their stories about that beer. --- # ![](https://images.hive.blog/100x0/https://i.imgur.com/2wCKc4z.png) The Weekly BeerSaturday Challenge ### The Challenge It's very simple: **share YOUR STORY about one of your favourite beer.** This is your chance to blog about **beer**, earn tokens, and why not use them to buy another beer for the next challenge. ### The Prizes **This week, we will give away 14 HIVE - 16 BEER - 2 LEO - 500 Ecency POINTS** You may also get some upvotes from us and our sponsors on your posts and comments as a bonus! Here is how our tokens will be distributed: ||HIVE|BEER|LEO|POINTS| |:-----------------: |:-----: |-|-|-| |Prize 1|6 HIVE|7 BEER|1 LEO|250 POINTS| |Prize 2|5 HIVE|5 BEER|1 LEO|250 POINTS| |Prize 3|3 HIVE|3 BEER||| _Prizes are drawn at random and each participant can only win one prize per week._ ### The Rules **1**. Create a post about on the beer topic Your post must : * contain at least **3 pictures** related to **beer** (feel free to add more) * contain a **story about beer** with **200+ words** * use the Hashtag **#BeerSaturday** **2**. Add a **comment onto this post** with the **link of your new post**. ***Remarks:*** - You may post on any day of the week - You can publish more than one post - The challenge ends on Thursday midnight UTC - Winnter will be announced on Friday. It's all about **quality content** and boosting this #BeerSaturday Challenge. --- ### ![](https://images.hive.blog/80x0/https://i.imgur.com/Zw8hCGo.png) Mention and invite a friend Add the following line to your message, but replace @username with the name of one of your friends. > This is #BeerSaturday week and I would like to invite @username to write a post in any language about beer with at least 3 pictures. body:
![Kvinna laedt ein.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/kvinna/EoiTjt9QbG39ERen18Fh3TVG5ARi7JDKDFAH3rHygMcTsvUiCVR162kXnk1Po2YjyJC.png)

![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/kvinna/EpQzjDNV56QMoydu7RDGC77CBfgcDjHdRd5n7M8DgGpWXaKzKRC2Su1E5AnmoXQM5Hz.png)

Liebe Hivians, der sommerliche September ist vorüber und das neunte monatliche Hive-Montags-Meetup am ersten Montag des Monats Oktober rückt in greifbare Nähe. Ich freue mich schon sehr darauf, den kommenden Montagabend mit Euch verbringen zu dürfen. Es wurde zwar schon mehrfach erwähnt, aber nun noch einmal offiziell für alle:

Montag, der 2.Oktober 2023

Beginn um 21.00h

### [Discordserver: Hive learn & more](https://discord.gg/W54CpGwfdR)
Die Rolle Hivian dürft Ihr Euch selbst geben, indem Ihr die Regeln **`lest`** und sie mit Drücken des Emojis akzeptiert. Sollte es Probleme geben, dann gerne eine PN an mich. 😉
Wir starten um 21.00h, um auch diejenigen mitzunehmen, die die lauen Abende Outdoor genießen möchten. Wer später kommen mag, darf das gerne tun, und auch stille Zuhörer sind herzlich willkommen❣️ So mancher mag sich vielleicht neben der Arbeitsschicht zuschalten, oder einfach nur noch auf Empfang stellen und entspannen. 😉
[![beer detlev.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/kvinna/ALG1MSuWTyHya9iEquGUXeLX2s85G3o7kbLuhtnTo6BTxAp6diS7D9M4DGTVwtp.png)](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created)
##### Mein heutiger Interviewpartner ist kein Geringerer als unser @detlev. Ihn kann man auf der Hive-Blockchain gar nicht übersehen. Er ist nicht nur der Ersteller des BEER-Tokens, sondern veranstaltet auch den BEERSATURDAY in seiner [BEER-Community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created). Informationen zum Token findet ihr unter @beerlover und sehr vieles auch noch auf @detlev 's Blog. Unser Bierexperte war auch einer der wenigen deutschsprachigen Hivians, die das @hivefest in Mexiko besucht haben. Zudem war er dort auch als Moderator tätig. Ich will, gar nicht so viel vorgreifen und alles, was Detlev so tut, hier aufzuführen, könnte leicht den Block sprengen. Also seid gespannt, was unser Beerlover uns alles zu berichten hat und nutzt die Chance ihn im Sprachkanal kennenzulernen und ihm auch direkt Fragen zu seinen Projekten zu stellen.
[![pfeil für float post.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/kvinna/AJebJ7oDfPsBcDFniak6YKskjiN7aoqs2crpwYqqjtBwCzazqfpzdy7gt1ehJ6H.png)](https://peakd.com/@hpud.wettbewerb)

###### Liebe NewBees, denkt morgen, den 1.10. an den @hpud.wettbewerb, den Post von @bechibenner findet ihr [hier](https://peakd.com/hive-121566/@hpud.wettbewerb/gewinnspiel-5hpud-wettbewerb-fur-newbees).
###### An alle Anderen hier, die Erinnerung zum Aufpowern und Bienchen holen am HPUD. Unterstützt bitte gerne die teilnehmenden Newbees und @bechibenner für seine fleißige Arbeit.

Wer schon weiß, dass er anwesend sein wird, darf das gerne in die Kommentare schreiben, damit ich mir einen Überblick über die potenzielle Teilnehmerzahl verschaffen kann. 😉

Unter dem Tag #mhmm (monatliches Hive Montags MeetUp) findet ihr zukünftig alle meine Posts, die dieses MeetUps betreffen.
Wer nicht mehr getagged/erwähnt werden möchte, schreibe das bitte in die Kommentare.
Über zahlreiches Erscheinen würde ich mich sehr freuen. Schnappt Euch diesmal am Besten ein Bier🍺 und macht es Euch beim neunten virtuellen Hive-Montags-MeetUp gemütlich.
--- ###### An dieser Stelle noch etwas Werbung für den @swisshive Community-Account, der von @yangyanje und @sandymeyer verwaltet wird! [Hier](https://peakd.com/hive-121566/@swisshive/swiss-events) findet ihr den Post mit spannenden Hive-Veranstaltungen 2023. ---

author: stortebeker
root_title: BeerSaturday - Unfiltered Pleasure Hazy Pale Ale under strict scrutiny
body:
Hello and happy #beersaturday to all those who enjoy a fine brew. Today I'm here with a German beer that sounds, looks, and tastes more like something you'd expect from some artsy microbrewery from California or British Columbia, instead of a German brewery. And yet, here it is: **Unfiltered Pleasure**, brewed and canned in Berlin, and even sold as *Bier* which I'm a bit surprised at myself.

![P_20230812_133047.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/stortebeker/23tmFr1n8RjdHdbmYF7Ls2eKg7DfMzshdCve8eC25P9Az5TYkSV44FnpMpAyK8wLLmuEr.jpg)

My friend and housemate brought this beer home from work last night. His employer **Gorilla** is a company that sells groceries online, including their own craft brew. However, since the entire business was bought up by one of their competitors, they can't sell their products that are labeled "Gorilla" any longer. But no one likes to see good beer go to waste, so we are glad to help out...

![P_20230812_133112.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/stortebeker/23xVPjqscdLyC6vYwPRiQ2C7kQm4SsLQR4Vrw6AABAcciHMyxjyhekG1mBa3NFKw6TkRM.jpg)

But back to why I was surprised at the German craft brew. Well, you may have heard of the **Deutsches Reinheitsgebot** or *German Purity Commandment* from 1516, which incidentally is the oldest food regulation of the world, according to which the ingredients of beer can only include hops, (barley) malt, yeast, and water. This purity law has an interesting history, ranging from draconian measures to the cultural heritage it is being attributed today. But this is also the reason, why fruity Belgian beers, or these hip and modern IPA variations are not permitted in Germany... Or even if they are, they can't be called *Bier*. Well, here is the proof that this is not the case.

![P_20230812_133327.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/stortebeker/23xAgeQUdhv6KnCBHHhJVLg5SDAPD7Zqwim3w6GRQrS9r1FsbcmDWjzRuwZDaxLkBm1ty.jpg)

Okay, so how would I describe this beer that I have found to be rather tasty in fact? Well, the hazy color is true to its name, looking a bit like a *Pfirsichschorle*, that is peach juice mixed with sparkling mineral water, another big favorite here in Germany. The taste is nice and hoppy (just as I love it), and even the foamy head used to be better, it just took me forever to take the pic. So good job, Gorilla, you have made a delicious brew I can recommend. Unfortunately, in order to enjoy it, you may need to know one of their employees, or wait until the new owners have rebranded their product.

So enjoy your Saturday, and your beer, if you're into it. Please visit the [challenge post](https://peakd.com/hive-187719/@detlev/beersaturday-319) of the #beersaturday challenge, stop by in the [BEER community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created), and make your own beer post, if you're interested. And yes, there are some prizes you can win too. **Cheers!**

author: tengolotodo
root_title: Leffe Blonde wins over Mrs T
body:
### Hello Hello Hivians, I hope you fancy a thirst quencher? Today is Saturday, and that means it is time to share a cheeky beer with you. Well actually this was last Saturday but it is still beer and that is what counts! So, this is my post for #beersaturday coming from our local Wetherspoons pub in Kirkcaldy, The Robert Nairn. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/EqL7GkfgHqNhbLTRteQG1HhG8R66Qa9LdM8zpAfP3eCZoNVCDPxWCU1MeKxpkm11n6m.png) We were actually there to taste a beer, or more precisely ensure that the pub served the beer in a correct glass. It was to perform a mystery shop on the pub.
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23zS56b4aU88QkQypHXhHCmKMXpDmFyacz3RFPCTAewX3YaW4FQN6yoM8RYuPmUYYSWQa.png)
Yes the beer in question was a type of Leffe. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREoadfKSsGzyuSnsFLq1mrjfW2mLAeRPZ5DB4jRPgi9K1U3x6qGyEsc1RDzr5sj7s.png) Was it served in a Leffe glass? Yes it was. And fluff me was it not a pretty sexy glass. It was a pint of beer and the glass held it comfortably.
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23rzHGWKi9LMEnidDjrMN1pPc6N4AMfF9tKD3c5eeiCZK29gkb5bQW7S5Vgb9Qvi76LEK.png)
Do you see the wee picture of an Abbey on the glass? I guess it is meant to be **The Abbey of Leffe** which was founded in 1152, and is situated on the river Meuse in the province of Namur which is in southern Belgium.
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/EpQxHT1KEsrxQrhGVkeKGyKMir5329rwEn4F3rpsGzrpgqh43j6cLWoqY9S7n2pMLaT.png)
Do you see the writing above Leffe? **ANNO 1240** In the UK loads of monasteries brewed meed and ale. It seemed mainland Europe was no different and in 1240 the Premonstratensian (Norbertine) canons of the Notre-Dame de Leffe abbey started to brewed ale in 1240.
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23w2sQkvtWPLsSAVGhaVAJUCor11gnMWJLC2a43Zga6hDVn5CMRzqebYFLsfHNLWJaj8c.png)
Remember that I said it was a sexy glass... look at the monastery on the stem! ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREoadfKSsGzyuSnsFLq1mrjfW2mLAeRPZ5DB4jRPgi9K1U3x6qGyEsc1RDzr5sj7s.png) ### So what the fluff does it taste like? Let's see what the [brewery](https://leffe.com/en/beer) itself says ... >Leffe Blonde is an authentic blond abbey beer with a slight hint of bitterness to it. It is delicate but characteristic, Leffe Blonde is the tasting beer par excellence: it gives an extra touch of flavor to simple dishes and lightly accompanies your fried foods. ☑️ Aroma: Floral and spicy with notes of vanilla and cloves ☑️ Taste: The strong malty aroma of Leffe Blonde reveals a sweet bitterness in perfect harmony with notes of vanilla and clove. ☑️ Alcohol content: 6.6% ☑️ Recommended serving temperature: 5 °C **What did I think!** I loved it! It had been a while since I had a Leffe blonde, but it was smooth and tasted like a beer, none of this wimpy 3.4% bollocks!
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23wqkHnn1kaxQFzzXWcyc3TSwzjba7Dot9dxnn5M5KfxcerPWSJW6wDapMnAWH844MVLy.png)
**What did Mrs T think!** Gin and Tonic or wine are the tipples of Mrs T, she is not a beer drinker, in fact she does not like any beer. I just had a feeling this was different. She took a taste... ### My god Mrs T exclaimed I have turned into my fluffing mother!!! I like it, yes I really like it! Talk about being shocked ... 👇👇This was the result 👇👇
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23xAXxgurJ4nb2SDBfeWbAky4qqwriNwm3orSh62J2NGqSaArkTpJ6FQLMeSWq77JiPsF.png)
No surprises then that the pub scored well! ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREoadfKSsGzyuSnsFLq1mrjfW2mLAeRPZ5DB4jRPgi9K1U3x6qGyEsc1RDzr5sj7s.png) This is my post for #beersaturday and [The #BeerSaturday Challenge - Week 315](https://peakd.com/hive-187719/@detlev/beersaturday-315) from @detlev in The [BEER](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) community. Have you got a cheeky beer this week @coquicoin @lhes ... ### Thanks for visiting and enjoy the rest of your day!
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREov743rX1e2zrSKj3rAPLUDZJi1nKQrkJ8uf1T4Axz9Pkg1nWMmuFu74BnchGAKP.png)
[![SB_theMenu_Banner.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/mondoshawan/EoEs3Nt6MvHXUTEeurge3264ftcpenP1XgLMBvt65mRJ6iwQ9tYKYdjraavD5hMWcjk.png)](https://peakd.com/hive-106316/@hive-106316/the-menu-a-silver-bloggers-guide-to-the-hive-iverse)
All images and ramblings are from me, the mad Scotsman TengoLoTodo unless otherwise stated. @tengolotodo July 15th 2023 ## **
DO WHAT YOU LOVE AND DO IT OFTEN
** **Haste Ye Back!**

author: tengolotodo
root_title: Northern Beer Saturday with  bonus beer batter!
body:
Hello Hello Hivians, I hope you are thirsty? Today is Saturday June 24th and the birthday of @pinkchic do go wish her happy birthday on her post [Happy Birthday, Self!](https://peakd.com/hive-178265/@pinkchic/happy-birthday-self). It is also the birthday of my late father and he did love a dark beer! So, this is a post for #beersaturday coming appropriately enough from Orkney, which are islands off the North of Scotland and where I bought my very first beer in a public bar whilst at school. I tell you what though, the prices ain't half changed! I remember when a fiver bought you three pints, now it does not buy 1!!! ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/EokfVZ8KNVDKzK59Hq4N4npE5Ear7ZTVqCdd6yN1xRLZEadBSzBkymCk1w9gHk6mmLf.png) ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREoadfKSsGzyuSnsFLq1mrjfW2mLAeRPZ5DB4jRPgi9K1U3x6qGyEsc1RDzr5sj7s.png) We had been doing some sight seeing on the way down to the Hope on South Ronaldsay. It is the southern most island that is joined by the last Churchill Barrier and I knew it was the home island of our AirBnB host. **We ended up in The Murray Arms for a pint and a bite to eat.** ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23xVMXepjTtc9KDhVugLtKBSoohMZ31G1LtwatDhNBDWh87YWrVJYBbd3rRdt4uxqUa31.png) The screenshot from my [pinmapple](https://www.pinmapple.com/@tengolotodo) page shows how far north we were ... ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/EowH5pdSQaPdjk67ZabTxC1fZyGbyb5WzNfBumxqD74vhiE2brDhEPem6sxikVoYonK.png) The drinks were ordered, I knew what I wanted. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/EprTYY6MWySTLyGaioZUNAMXFR8mDUXyEEyQqxoYuZaPHbZH3ZyLagAriUpKDZSxkJg.png) A glass of tap water and a coke for Mrs T. The water in Scotland is great, there is no need to order a bottle of water. For me it was not a pint of Caledonian Best.. It was a dark beer though as you can tell, the dark gives it away. ### The pint in question was a pint of Dark Island. Over the years, I have drunk my fair share of it...
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23zS1ATwUKMVuqUpxcinJtedfwzRqX9QNpqucSgs3PxixCMWnNza1GNRCpkJCpau339MF.png)
Dark Island is an iconic beer from [The Orkney Brewery](https://www.orkneybrewery.co.uk/) Unfortunately they are a bit out of the way on the West side of The Mainland near Skara Brae the 5000 year old settlement. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREoadfKSsGzyuSnsFLq1mrjfW2mLAeRPZ5DB4jRPgi9K1U3x6qGyEsc1RDzr5sj7s.png) ### So what the fluff does it taste like? Let's see what the brewery itself says ... >### Chocolatey: Rich: Delicious Dark Island is an iconic beer. A gold standard-bearer for crafted premium Scottish Ales. It almost needs no introduction. It offers ripe, fruity and roast coffee aromas with flavours of dark chocolate, dates and nuts, from the combination of roasted malts and robust hops. ABV 4.6 % IBU 19 HOPS First Gold: East Kent Goldings MALT Pale: Crystal: Chocolate: Malted Wheat Interestingly they rate it a 3 on the bitter-to-sweet scale. I like it, and that is what matters! **What did we eat I hear you ask!** Well as we are talking about beer for beer Saturday, of course we had the Orkney beer battered fish and chips... Fluffing delicious it was! ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/Eou9DD52XD6nESGWPX7wcC7aB1erPxxWUpsEWpCRMuo57LjgLmUYnR4txD3r6tyZJMg.png) We ate inside as it was a roasting day and there were no tables left that had any shade. We got home later, and it transpired that the pub is owned by our host's niece! It was well worth a visit, and they have totally revamped the bar and restaurant. The food is local seafood mainly and it is good. As it should be as the owners family also owns two fishing and two scallop boats! This is my post for #beersaturday and [The #BeerSaturday Challenge - Week 312](https://peakd.com/hive-187719/@detlev/beersaturday-312) from @detlev in The [BEER](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) community. Have you got a cheeky beer this week @coquicoin @lhes ... ### Thanks for visiting and enjoy the rest of your day! ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tengolotodo/23tbREov743rX1e2zrSKj3rAPLUDZJi1nKQrkJ8uf1T4Axz9Pkg1nWMmuFu74BnchGAKP.png)
[![SB_theMenu_Banner.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/mondoshawan/EoEs3Nt6MvHXUTEeurge3264ftcpenP1XgLMBvt65mRJ6iwQ9tYKYdjraavD5hMWcjk.png)](https://peakd.com/hive-106316/@hive-106316/the-menu-a-silver-bloggers-guide-to-the-hive-iverse)
All images and ramblings are from me, the mad Scotsman TengoLoTodo unless otherwise stated. @tengolotodo June 24th 2023 ## **
DO WHAT YOU LOVE AND DO IT OFTEN
** **Haste Ye Back!**

root_title: Beer Saturday - Pre-Loading, Getting on the Guest Lists, Hip Hop and a Few tasty Beers (Video of Gig Included)
body:
![Beer Saturday Lowkey.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/raj808/23wMTvwYBsTehRZ77vezQd6bmRz6PtTKUeJqqtzZtiVwp5kkZdv3SG8gAyiUqvnUqhFZU.jpg) #### Getting on the Guest List of my Favourite UK Rapper & Pre-loading Explained I had an epic day/night last Friday, seeing an activist/anarchist rapper called Lowkey. A friend of mine who is involved in activism here in Liverpool text me saying she could get me on the Guest list to see my favourite UK rapper and blinding talent, [Lowkey.](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkUMk5PAKx2DHRYzfr8i4AA/featured) I hastily said yes to her to put me on the list, and I'd get back to her with two other names. "Be quick, as they're going like hotcakes" was the text response. Unfortunately, I only had a few hours and 2 potential free guest list spots so I got frantic texting all my friends saying "hey, does anyone want on the guest list for a HipHop gig tonight headlining Lowkey"... and the lazy shower of bastards that they are 😂 I got nothing back until 4 hours later when one of my friends responded saying she'd love to come along. I'd had a text 2 hours earlier saying all spots were gone now, so I had to disappoint my friend. Going alone to a gig is well and truly stepping out of my comfort zone. I used to have severe anxiety and couldn't strike up a conversation with anyone unless they initiated it... but that's just life, sometimes it gives you lemons, I say make a nice salad dressing, and get on with it. Since those times though, travelling/backpacking has forced me to confront these neuroses and learn how to strike up a conversation with a complete stranger. But I'm getting ahead of myself... this is the Beer Community I hear you cry! Where are the beers? Well, I'll start off with the first subject in the title, Pre-loading. I'm not sure if it is a quintessentially British thing (let me know in the comments if anyone outside the UK does know about this hallowed ritual). Pre-loading is when you find out you're going to an awesome gig, but then you hunt down the bar prices and realise you're looking at £7/pint of beer on tap. For all of those capital city dwellers laughing at me and saying "That is s a bargain, it's a tenner for a pint in London." All I can say is we're blessed up here in Liverpool that the average cost of a pint of lager (my main drink of choice) is around £3.75 and real ales, especially cask ales, can be below the £3 mark. So knowing that I would be rinsed at the gig if I drank heavily I decided to pre-load (basically this means drinking 4-6 pints prior to going to the gig at local pubs that are cheap). ![20190802_162951.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/raj808/244UmRT5rP3gtFJVDsSuq8wP4xrFERSn4j5EcEhcPfnvdLg6iWhaTKmF4gZ8TFokf3nP6.jpg) The sun was blazing that day so I decided to get on my bike and ride down to the waterfront to a pub called [The Britannia Inn](https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g186337-d4168361-Reviews-Britannia_Inn_Stonehouse_Pizza_Carvery-Liverpool_Merseyside_England.html) that looks out on the river, which sells a reasonably priced pint of Peroni, and they keep the glasses in the freezer, old school, keeping your beer frosty for longer. What can I say about lager... some of it is good, some bad and some just in-between. I like Peroni, it has a mild crispness to it, less sharp than a decent pilsner which is also a favourite of mine but gets a bit much after the three-pint mark. After two pints I decided to ride home for a shower (as there's a massive hill up to my apartment) and then ate a hasty dinner before heading out to my local pub, [The Cambridge,](https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/Restaurant_Review-g186337-d12656446-Reviews-The_Cambridge-Liverpool_Merseyside_England.html) for pre-loading part two. ![IMG_20190302_161134.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/raj808/EoEo8KPvRkJjq78sk5kueaBUW7QQuyUdRo6tM5gody67k2pAsUUPAEfCUdsoDGdfwPD.jpg) At this point, I broke my rule and had a pint of cask ale, as I'd done my research on the venue and the only beer they had on tap was Birra Moretti at the venue ['The District',](https://www.skiddle.com/whats-on/Liverpool/District-/) which I've always found to taste somewhere halfway between an ale and a lager, so I thought what the hell. In brief, and for a bit of context I've suffered an 8-year chronic gut condition and real ale nearly always gives me terrible stomach problems for many days afterwards... but god damn if they aren't tasty. I tried this Shropshire Gold pictured 🔼 and found it to be quite refreshing and not far from my usual choice of lager, although I could really taste the floral hoppy notes dancing on my tongue, which balanced out a nice crisp malty aftertaste. You'll have to forgive me for getting a bit pretentious with the description. I used to work as a barman in a pub that was on the [CAMRA](https://camra.org.uk/) tour itinerary. For anyone outside the UK, they are a slightly overzealous real ale-drinking society that can make or break a pub with a good or bad review. This was the first time I'd tried real ale in 8 months due to its usual effect on me and this stuff slipped down a treat. Two pints later, I decided not to push my luck and ordered a pint of Fosters. ![20230125_172312.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/raj808/23wC5V33wNBuXzXh6QUEtBwqY1W8Qg3ZfWT1CBV9K9zdd3cDKfFJaTLTsS1vvuSAFacBV.jpg) 😂🤣 I'm not going to start extolling the virtues of Fosters, it's pretty tasteless and inoffensive and definitely falls in the category I mentioned earlier, in lager terms, as somewhere right in the middle. All I know is I had a decent buzz on now after 5 pints and I wasn't down by more than £20, so as the gig had been going one hour already I wandered down to 'up and coming' hipster heaven that is [the Baltic triangle](https://www.visitliverpool.com/explore/liverpool-city-centre/baltic-triangle/) and the gig at The District. Now as I mentioned before I still suffer (sometimes) from quite crippling self-consciousness. But as I walked into this place (maybe it was the swagger of being on the guest list) I felt absolutely fine. I leaned on the bar and sipped on a pint of the £7 Birra Moretti which was a tasty brew, but I'm not sure it was ‘£7 a pint tasty’ 🍺😉 ![1684575755304.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/raj808/AJkQXXoQcBjz9PeuMBECUsdkchnUoBbwhUqzvUdQZjN8rgFBQcaG9xvMyek7ibj.jpg) All joking aside I really do like Birra Moretti, it is a very full-bodied flavourful lager, especially for an Italian lager. Anyway, my Pre-loading tactics had worked and I wasn't guzzling the beers down like I usually do. There were some warm-up acts of performance poetry and I was actually full of beans that day because I found the organiser of the event and asked if it was an open mic, as I have loads of my poetry (check my collections page on PeakD if you want to read any I've published here) stored on my phone. She was very kind and said no, all the acts were timed to perfection so there weren't any open slots. As I only smoke when I drink I used the age-old trick of joining the smoker's area, and I'd tactically not brought a lighter with me, which can be an unobtrusive way to spark up a conversation with whoever you get some fire from 😅 the first group of people I met were pretty much in a group and seemed caught up in their own conversations so I didn't butt in like the proverbial third wheel. As the night drew on - and my bank account grew lighter - the Birra Moretti was just the ticket as it was cold and refreshing, and the gig was hot due to the mini-heat wave we've been having here in the UK. I found myself talking to loads of people, & even had an impromptu poetry slam in the garden with a young poet whose girlfriend was buzzing from flow between us both as we upped our speed and rhythm in delivering our poems. I performed 'Moral Mediocrity' performed @ 0.58 mins in this YouTube performance: https://youtu.be/Bi_3BdVYoM0 And I followed this up with a poem I wrote a while ago called 40% Off. https://youtu.be/yC-lxCDKArA Both poems show my ambivalence toward capitalism in its current form, and anarchistic leanings. It was that type of atmosphere so they went down well. I felt really fired up that night and read the poem 'Moral Mediocrity' better than in the performance I shared above in the heat of an impromptu poetic battle. Don’t underestimate the power of 🍻 😂 As I returned inside after this thoroughly pleasant encounter the geezer I'd been trading poems with said "come find us near the front of the stage when Lowkey comes on dude." This just goes to show if you don't get out of your comfort zone sometimes, everything will remain the same. #### And now for the music... This video contains short clips of the gig, as I was quite drunk, but also didn’t want to be ‘that guy’ just holding his phone up for hours, I wanted to experience the gig without the constant meta-mania of having to record everything. Having said all that, I got a few clips of the main support act Dorcas - a multi-discipline creative talent from Liverpool, specializing in drama, poetry and singing. I also got two short clips of the headline act, Lowkey who I’ve wanted to see for years. Check out the Alphabet Aerobics (rapping from A - Z) he freestyles in the final clip. https://youtu.be/V4uIlS0q00c I only managed to capture from A – E as again, I didn't want to lose the immediacy of the moment by focusing on my phone too much 😂 but believe me the rest was impressive. As a final act of creativity, which is what that gig was all about for me, it was palpable in the air as the place was packed to the gills with musicians, poets, rappers and artists. Here is a little poem I wrote inspired by the gig, and the night as a whole. *I stepped out of my comfort zone going to a gig on my own. Anxiety can't beat me, after an impromptu poetry slam in the garden, I felt free like I’d found my tribe and it was okay to just be me spitting rhymes while walking the walk I also felt fierce after my girlfriend gave me an amazing pep talk maybe I had one too many Birra moretti but what the fuck you only live once anyway.* **Poetry is © @raj808 (YouTube: MainlyPoetry)** I hope you enjoyed the snippet of the '50 years of hip hop with Lowkey and Friends' concert hosted/organized by [Writing on the Wall.](https://writingonthewall.org.uk/) **Thanks for reading/watching🙂🍻** https://steemitimages.com/DQmaiuGasc2vGC6wrf3Nu7Su5GTzNSx9UJGuApEhdjAZvzU/9.png
This is #BeerSaturday week and I would like to invite @stickupboys to write a post about beer if any of the lads have managed to get out to the beer garden this week?
I'd also like to take this opportunity to thanks @detlev the founder of the [Beer Community.](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) I'm pretty sure this is the only place on the internet where you write about your favourite beer, and share your anecdotes fuelled night's out (or in), and receive money on your post through peer review.
If you are interested in reading/writing short stories, or posts with creative writing tips, and fiction in general, check out 'The Ink Well', the community I built and founded, by clicking the third banner below.

body:
Amigos de esta [Comunidad Cervecera](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created). El domingo salimos a San Telmo, aquí en Buenos Aires, Argentina, a comprar algunos recuerdos. Confieso que quedé maravillada con todo lo que se puede comprar allí y si quieres comer, también ofrecen una gran variedad gastronómica. El caso es que después de ese gran recorrido por todas las tiendas y ferias, donde pude comprar dulce de leche, alfajores y otras cosas, decidimos ir a la hermosa Costanera, en Puerto Madero. Es una zona hermosa para pasear y disfrutar del paisaje acuático. >Friends of this Brewing Community. On Sunday we went out to San Telmo, here in Buenos Aires, Argentina, to buy some souvenirs. I confess that I was amazed with everything you can buy there and if you want to eat, they also offer a great gastronomic variety. The thing is that after that great tour of all the stores and fairs, where I could buy dulce de leche, alfajores and other things, we decided to go to the beautiful Costanera, in Puerto Madero. It is a beautiful area to walk around and enjoy the water scenery. ![PEÑON DEL AGUILA UNO.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EoCgBEmbAApEqC7EQaBNVNShaGbuhZQ7LLpD8P2NjXAbPXKg5RRupLM539TisNoGnCz.jpg) *** Finalmente, decidimos volver al Puente de La Mujer, porque desde la última vez que pasé por allí, me dieron ganas de tomar algo en la famosa cervecería flotante, Peñón del Águila, donde también se puede ver el hermoso río, edificios comerciales, tiendas, restaurantes, etc. Pero siempre estaba lleno de gente. Así que aprovechamos que había poca gente y decidimos hacer una parada para degustar una cerveza. >Finally, we decided to go back to Puente de La Mujer, because since the last time I passed by there, I felt like having a drink at the famous floating brewery, Peñón del Águila, where you can also see the beautiful river, commercial buildings, stores, restaurants, etc. But it was always crowded. So we took advantage of the fact that there were few people and decided to stop for a beer. *** ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/AK7yarHTZ1TtSirYS7Mjf4tnb1oA7UWJrnAgSsBcQpxgKWGbP6VXwkvG4jV3sov.png) *** Esta vez había menos afluencia de clientes, claro estaba igualmente llena, pero pudimos lograr entrar y recibir la debida atención. La cual fue muy oportuna y eficiente. Nos ofrecieron la carta y nos encontramos con unas cervezas de sabores exóticos si se quiere, pues sus nombres y mezclas eran diferentes a las cervezas comunes. Acá en Argentina se ha proliferado la elaboración de cerveza artesanal y créanme que son espectaculares. >This time there was less affluence of clients, of course it was equally full, but we were able to get in and receive the proper attention. Which was very timely and efficient. They offered us the menu, and we found some beers with exotic flavors if you will, because their names and mixtures were different from the common beers. Here in Argentina, craft beer brewing has proliferated and believe me, they are spectacular.
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EoeEtWoG7hVoF2APDhizAjMmrAfrma1dUjGbXLZDqoKZhyWynr8h31gsPRfFYX9a3N5.png)
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EokdYddHRXy8cz3L8svJHxijrf5kxMbqrNxZzMrFB97UUg5Mnfh7KZCC3cbJ2Lw87Zt.png)
Emocionada y con mucha curiosidad, pedí una que estaba elaborada con frambuesa, la **Waldbier **. Realmente se sintió muy liviana, sabor entre dulce y amargo, además estaba muy fría. Así que del 1 al 10 le doy un nueve. Otro de los sabores que pude catar fue la Oktoberfest, y no sé a qué se debió su nombre, pero realmente era todo un festival de sabores, la malta y el caramelo le dan ese toque extrañamente delicioso producto de la mezcla satánica como le escuche decir a algunos presentes. Por último nos queda una superespecial llamada SourMaracuyá. La fruta maracuyá es muy popular en América Latina. Y esta mezcla y el toque de acidez se convirtió en boca, en un elixir refrescante. Todas tiene bajo contenido de alcohol. Por supuesto, no se debe abusar de ninguna bebida alcohólica. Pues es dañina para la salud cuando se convierte en un vicio. >Excited and very curious, I ordered one that was brewed with raspberry, the **Waldbier **. It really felt very light, taste between sweet and bitter, plus it was very cold. So from 1 to 10 I give it a nine. Another of the flavors that I tasted was the Oktoberfest, and I don't know why it got its name, but it was really a festival of flavors, malt and caramel give it that touch strangely delicious product of the satanic mixture as I heard some people say. Lastly we have a super special called SourPassion Fruit. Passion fruit is very popular in Latin America. And this blend and the touch of acidity became a refreshing elixir in the mouth. All have low alcohol content. Of course, no alcoholic beverage should be abused. For it is harmful to health when it becomes a vice. *** ![PEÑON DEL AGUILA DOS.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EoCbr4Awmefo1ELQzkAbdG6USm1AZDqAJBpzNqHy3ur9GyUv15qg4Mt21iPrgEb9vXy.jpg) *** En la imagen anterior, se divisa **El Puente de La Mujer**y su hermoso reflejo en las aguas del río de Puerto Madero, un lugar de ensueños. Nos retiramos satisfechos de esta visita. Con las ganas de regresar. > In the previous image, you can see **El Puente de La Mujer** and its beautiful reflection in the waters of the river of Puerto Madero, a place of dreams. We left satisfied with this visit. With the desire to return. *** ![PEÑON DEL AGUILA COLLAGE.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/AK7xz5e4f7tp7SSphQdzu2FLAuVt7y7Kx3U8SFhxNvZEKRh7JERbjv71iAnwyBY.jpg) *** ***
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/23y9HShRrpMQH69VGx5oMsQDxzqjhGqijNJz4tcqfeFeGbKnVnafaqeP4w4HsiS4WpTzA.png)
![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/23tSz8J2vtZ1fdEuggYZbXuCEE6Uh591QbGrrLJRVdG66cxXthjyXswmesc5nkpY6cFJj.png)

Cervezas y Tragos

***

Clásicos para acompañar

![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/23xytnfWkVLpDJhBLtFdwRZJiR7RGaztYpqDTnTeck4iG77hzysZyvwPwAKUn6pAWj6As.png) *** Estas "Papas Ranch, por supuesto, fue mi selección y la combinación perfecta para hacer de mis papilas gustativas, una verdadera fiesta de sabores. Me convenció la salsa ranch tradicional, con el queso mozzarella derretido, el toque que le da la panceta ahumada junto al verdeo, provocando una espectacular explosión de sabores. Todo ello, maridado con la cerveza tipo Oktoberfest, ⁣ selló la inolvidable velada como homenaje al paladar. >These "Papas Ranch, of course, was my selection and the perfect combination to make my taste buds, a real feast of flavors. I was convinced by the traditional ranch sauce, with the melted mozzarella cheese, the touch that gives the smoked bacon and the green pepper, causing a spectacular explosion of flavors. All this, paired with Oktoberfest beer, sealed the unforgettable evening as a tribute to the palate. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EqfKoCScefCwYhGTg3AhJxdBr4HRnq2ZXxMe7KnyF4qWU9oFgBiZgBJ3nCDD6ym4kta.png) *** This is #BeerSaturday week and I'd like to invite @lisfabian to write a post in any language about beer with at least 3 images. ![image.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/numa26/EoGxN6p46LUzCtKyHCSYxVWqyWNq7sDPMhCphyK1sZhz3mE17CGa8YZUgyvgpjCzUZK.png) >Esta es la semana de #BeerSaturday y me gustaría invitar a @lisfabian a escribir una publicación en cualquier idioma sobre la cerveza con al menos 3 imágenes. >This is #BeerSaturday week and I'd like to invite @lisfabian to write a post in any language about beer with at least 3 images. ***

author: behiver
root_title: Hive blockchain - Top 100 Communities and runner-ups
body:
The Hive blockchain is a huge web3 platform where content is pouring from everywhere and covering a great diversity of subjects and interests. One that joins this platform is easily overwhelmed by the immensity of it all and might find it hard to find a place of its own within this ecosystem. But there is a solution to it and that is given by communities that play a vital role in Hive's ecosystem by enabling users to connect with like-minded individuals and create and discover content that aligns with their interests. Usering joining communities we'll ensure targeted channels for them to publish their content, engage with others, and receive support and feedback. Without them, we are simply lost and hard to be spotted through hundreds of thousands or even millions of other users and their specific content.

![hive_community.jpg](https://images.hive.blog/DQmdnH56h33vNq3AB9DJt2HewXKWRmiFFcnVGXrrm3Trrog/hive_community.jpg)

The role of communities on Hive goes beyond content curation and rewards distribution through upvoting, which surely is still a strong motivating factor. They also provide a space for users to build relationships and develop a sense of belonging. As users interact with one another in a community, they establish a shared identity and a sense of common purpose. This fosters a sense of community ownership and responsibility that encourages users to contribute to the growth and development of the community. And as the community grows, also its members will grow and receive more rewards and perks.

## Top 100 Communities on the Hive blockchain

Whether community members work together to develop new projects, create informative resources, organize events and meetups, or simply contribute content to a domain they are passionate about, it is clear that without them Hive would fall into chaos and anyone would be hard to be spotted. In order to alleviate the search of communities on the Hive blockchain, I've built up a Top 100 Communities list based on the number of members. While this doesn't distinguish if the members are active or not, I think it is a good starting point for anyone to see the main communities.

author: amazingdrinks
body:
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmNYhSj8hsnTS2Hv2H7Ez8FTZB3iQJr1px3Tb7TZSY7KTJ/moira_4_.png)
We are water. The 75% of our body is water, which is why we constantly need to ingest liquids to live, so like food, drinks are very important in the human diet. And beyond their function of maintenance and nutrition, there is the enjoyment that they offer us in general.
And it is precisely to celebrate and spread the world's drinks that the Amazing Drinks community was born, a space where all drinks have a home. No matter what type of drink it is, here is your ideal niche, well, there are exceptions, such as coffee, beer and wine; but these ingredients can be used in the preparation of cocktails or other drinks that include them in their preparation.
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmdVNDUbGy9TuqT4bR39f8PgvA6QGBmtStcEJWRp7dD2w3/kim_daniels_0entgdz8ols_unsplash.jpg)
Whether they are juices, milkshakes, smoothies, infusions, teas (medicinal or not), chocolate, mate, fruit juices, liqueurs, cocktails, punches, creams, spritzers, distillates... everything that is drinkable has its space in this community. And although we are a Plant Power (Vegan) friendly community, at Amazing Drinks you can share non-vegan recipes.
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmT57RS7h2M6YnBCpzfNZgEgaU16xPqGWix7Xxq6JfXnLi/separador_removebg_preview.png)
# What can you post on Amazing Drinks? You can post about: ***
+ Juices. + Smoothies. + Juices. + Teas (medicinal or not). + Infusions (medicinal or not) + Soft drinks. + Cocktails. + Strikeouts. + Mates. + And any other drink, except for those indicated in the previous section. + You can also do drink reviews, but you should focus on the drink experience. + Food and drink pairing. + Mixology.
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmT57RS7h2M6YnBCpzfNZgEgaU16xPqGWix7Xxq6JfXnLi/separador_removebg_preview.png)
# What can't you post on Amazing Drinks? Posts about: ***
+ Soups. + Broths + Consommés. + No drinks that include any meat product, (although eggs, milk and honey are allowed). + Posts about coffee (there is an active community with that niche, which you can visit, here we share the link: [Cinnamon Cup Coffee](https://peakd.com/c/hive-152524/created) + Posts about beers (there is an active community with that niche, which you can visit, here we share the link: [BEER](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) + Posts about wines (there are two communities with this niche, which you can visit). Here we share the links: [Cheers](https://peakd.com/c/hive-161993/created) and [Food&Wine Lovers](https://peakd.com/c/hive-161745/created)
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmSbJA8GRsCgEscuB9GnJGneNJDz8jBEBEB41ZHYx8HxKf/sam_hojati_lw8gflbjwlc_unsplash.jpg)
We invite you to join the Amazing Drinks community! Where all drinks have their home. Do you want to support us?
+ Then join our [voting trail](https://hive.vote/dash.php?i=1&trail=amazingdrinks) + Or if you like you can support us as [delegator](https://peakd.com/@amazingdrinks/wallet) of this new niche.
![](https://images.ecency.com/DQmT57RS7h2M6YnBCpzfNZgEgaU16xPqGWix7Xxq6JfXnLi/separador_removebg_preview.png)
#
Long live all the wonderful and amazing drinks in the world, all at Amazing Drinks!
![BANNER AMAZING.png](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/amazingdrinks/23x1UJKLHeCKbb4T6dmEkAadAqXBD8sw1t7htK3vdj3Mtbg5LbmRS1HLaxkEjQHU7d2xx.png) [Delegations welcome!](https://peakd.com/@amazingdrinks/wallet)
Find our community [here](https://peakd.com/c/hive-189869/created)
[Curation Trail]( https://hive.vote/dash.php?i=1&trail=amazingdrinks)

body:
Still on vacation and a bit jetlagged, I thought it was Sunday and not Monday. That's why this morning I wrote my post for [**BeerSaturday**](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) (I encourage you to participate). I was looking at what my selection would be in our [**Street Art community**](https://peakd.com/c/hive-184784) when I realized that Weekly Street Art was today 😀.

> *Toujours en vacances et un peu décalé, je croyais que nous étions dimanche et non lundi. C'est pour cela que ce  matin j'ai écrit mon post pour [**BeerSaturday**](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) (je vous encourage à y participer). J'étais en train de regarder quelle serait ma sélection dans notre  communauté [**Street Art**](https://peakd.com/c/hive-184784) quand j'ai réalisé que le Weekly Street Art était aujourd'hui* 😀.

![485 - Stela ruelle De Rouen.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/Eou8JoDxUKsXZeeDbSjgf4yE7oSDzXGRxd1pmyfxBJXWc41nUWorx1WK1nSFSkgmamj.jpg)

For this week, I propose you a cool tag made by **Stela**, a feminist artist who often paints this big-eyed head with always a strong message underneath. But it's been a long time since I've seen new tags by this artist. Too bad.

> *Pour cette semaine, je vous propose un tag réalisé par **Stela**, artiste féministe qui peint souvent cette tête aux grands yeux avec en dessous toujours un message fort. Mais cela fait longtemps que je n'ai pas vu de nouveaux tags de cette artiste. Dommage.*

![line_hive.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/xoycoMPQ-line_hive.jpg)

Here are the 3 articles selected this week, always subjective because there are many very interesting posts.  I remind you that I put the pictures in black and white just to give you an idea. It's worth going to see the original photos on the post (and at the same time, you can upvote).

> **🇫🇷** *Voici les 3 article sélectionnés cette semaine, toujours subjectif car il y a de nombreux posts très intéressant. Je vous rappelle que je mets les photos en noir et blanc juste pour vous donner un aperçu. Cela vaut le coup d'aller voir les photos originales sur le post (et en même temps de faire un upvote)* : 

***

## @quinnertronics - Cleveland (US)

![01.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/23tvVWvWPtMuxceTA7F3AZqkhTZp5eEhf5uNdaM7FmePTZp4wTzoDbCtLQBBv2isXr1xw.jpg)

We start this week with a little walk around Cleveland with some mural photos taken by **@quinnertronics** including this one which I particularly like, perfect for this house with this symmetry. The style reminds me of the artist **Other** who made a similar mural during the Mural Festival in Montreal in 2013 (see the mural on [muralfestival.com](https://muralfestival.com/artist/other/)). And above all he also shares with us a beautiful series of letterings on train cars.

***

> *Nous commençons cette semaine par une petite promenade à Cleveland avec quelques photos de murales prises par **@quinnertronics** dont celle-là que j'aime particulièrement, parfaite pour cette maison avec cette symétrie. Le style me rappelle l'artiste **Other** qui avait réalisé une murale semblable lors du Mural Festival à Montréal en 2013 (voir la murale sur [muralfestival.com](https://muralfestival.com/artist/other/)). Et surtout il nous partage aussi une belle série de lettrages sur des wagons de train.*

**📰** [**A Few Murals From Cleveland And A Bunch of Train Art Photos**](https://peakd.com/hive-184784/@quinnertronics/a-few-murals-from-cleveland-and-a-bunch-of-train-art-photos)

![line_hive.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/xoycoMPQ-line_hive.jpg)

##  @alberto0607 - Bloque feminista - Barranquilla (Colombia)

![02.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/23vsBdTpY6m9WqWMT9gN97T5eHMxH4xbdPeAs8dga93rsb5nX8yGAxLb3u1SK6QYKgHvW.jpg)

We travel further south to Colombia to see that Street Art can beautify a city and make an unattractive place more welcoming with a strong message like this mural photographed by **@alberto0607**. Beautiful realization of [**Bloque feminista**](https://www.instagram.com/bloquefeministamasm/) with also a message for the equality man / woman, the right of the LGBT+ communities...

***

> *Nous voyageons plus au sud pour aller en Colombie pour voir que le Street Art peut embellir une ville et rendre un endroit peu attrayant en un lieu plus accueillant avec un message fort comme cette murale photographiée par **@alberto0607**. Belle réalisation de [**Bloque feminista**](https://www.instagram.com/bloquefeministamasm/) avec aussi un message pour l'égalité homme / femme, le droit des communautés LGBT+...*

**📰** [**Mural Justicia (Bloque Feminista)**](https://peakd.com/hive-184784/@alberto0607/street-art-2-mural-justicia)

![line_hive.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/xoycoMPQ-line_hive.jpg)

## @street-ar - Heidelberg (Germany)

![03.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/23wWxriuLmGiP9rF4587Rgc2JzPXEM749xBu11rDscBmCns8DdYwQSG5tUbN1ztxQFeJL.jpg)

And finally, back to Germany with **@street-ar** with this great lettering made by an unknown artist, Meta (?). I love this style with a mix of abstraction and figurative. And a big thank you for these many posts each week, only quality. Keep it up, always a pleasure to see your pictures.

***

> *Et pour finir, retour en Allemagne avec **@street-ar** avec ce superbe lettrage réalisé par un artiste inconnu, Meta (?). J'adore ce style avec un mélange d'abstraction et de figuratif. Et un gros merci pour ces nombreux posts chaque semaine, seulement de la qualité. Continue, toujours un plaisir de voir tes photos.*

**📰** [**Abstarct Street Art - Heidelberg Germany**](https://peakd.com/hive-184784/@street-ar/abstarct-street-art-heidelberg-germany)

![line_hive.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/heroldius/xoycoMPQ-line_hive.jpg)

That's all for this week... The [**Street Art**](https://peakd.com/c/hive-184784) community welcomed **2 new members for a total of 1,119**. author: tanjakolader
root_title: Belle-Vue Extra Kriek For Those Non-Beer-Drinkers 🍻 #BeerSaturday - Week 289
body:
#### ***In Suriname there are not many options when it comes to beer and at the novelty bar - where there's a bit more options - we went to with friends, the price could add up. Not sure about the amount of choices in the Netherlands, bus as I'm new here I try to venture out and find out what I like and what not.***
![1673950777699.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/23wMYjwrkCsbaTgSLqdNBJgayrdw7Y8pNtvgB22iS5x5d9NqknH465BXUZAPTeJoC4qJd.jpg) ---
So last Saturday when we were invited to have a drink and to catch up, I wanted to try another type of beer or if anything another flavor of the same brand. Beer from the ***IJWIT*** brand seems to be recommended quite a few times, but I already had the ["staple"](https://peakd.com/hive-187719/@tanjakolader/first-time-trying-locally-brewed-beer-from-the-netherlands-ijwit) the last time.
![1673950777409.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/23vi4233Rssarrqs4eLViS5a3KrKb3zk43sQhjB59aGZkb1q3bjuBxwFnY1Rwa3jhpnup.jpg)
Trying to go off of what I usually drink, a local suggested to try ***Belle-Vue Kriek***, which is a fruit flavored Belgian beer. The taste is a good balance between sweet and sour, with a hint of bitterness as aftertaste. This drink is a great way to introduce non-beer-drinkers into some beer flavors. One amongst us, who doesn't like the taste of beer, couldn't keep his hands off this drink.
![1673950777170.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/23xAcQfNDaEDctjLm4qTdN5R8e5FH7E4WQqz5ws6hnWXNp3FksWZqGaBjsdqbz7qvrLaM.jpg)
As we craved pizza earlier that week, we finally ordered a pepperoni pizza. It was what one would expect from a bar: regular tasting. It wasn't spectacular but also not horrible. The pizza had a soft crust and there were enough pepperonis and paprika as toppings. The price to quality/quantity ratio were in balance.
![1673950776992.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/EoeCa5jZJwBXtbbs92B8F9JdkxZ1p4b6VgLTB3Y3WeK6P5TVDfWK5XpBUnFVxhGKCvi.jpg) --- ![1673950776690.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/23uEzLDqcAeAj3a1oNi4QswudewEq6R46VQABjFgtNnhv6WGc5rj3pyKu5Pu3m7sRvbcd.jpg) --- ![1673950776472.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/tanjakolader/23xKnLwUFaZnEPEJQQJLXtEPVnmPZSuD8ffUoJ1f2kFBaZ6He2oH8ZaPfrjqagPG5rDw1.jpg)
The industrial interior had something pre-war rustic and warm. Maybe because of the closeness of the tables and people, as one would often find in Amsterdam. It gave a vibe of times-gone-by and yet relevant to the modern person. Service was friendly and timely with the food and drinks. It was a night out well spend, with good conversations, alright food and above all a good glass of beer.
#### ***Which beer got your attention last week? Let me know in the comments below*** 🤓. And I would like to invite @dmilliz to introduce us to the brands of beer in his part of the world. ---
### ***Chasse into the backstage! 💃*** #### Interested in partaking in the #BeerSaturday challenge? Be sure to read [this post](https://peakd.com/hive-187719/@detlev/omg-we-have-beersaturday-week-289) and/or follow @detlev and the Hive [Beer Community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) for more information. Looking forward to reading all about it 🤓.

author: karizma
root_title: WATT'ne Bierspezialität ;) / Watt a beer specialty ;) [DE/ENG]
body:
![Dein Abschnittstext(1).jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/23ywudLCTMwnvENhJWAJCB2jaorCf9P6MWsexv7eUvb7Bn6c68TcHLusd6L7nbkXWPtZD.jpg)

Hallo liebe Freunde des Bieres,
letzte Woche in unserem Herbsturlaub war es wieder soweit. Ich habe eine neue Biersorte verköstigt.
Wir waren in Ostfriesland an der schönen Nordsee an haben an diesem Tag eine Wattwanderung gemacht. Es war herrliches Wetter, also haben wir uns eine Picknickdecke und ein paar Snacks mit an den Strand gebracht. Mit dabei war eine Flasche Hemelinger spezial.
Das Hemelinger spezial wird bereits seit 1878 gebraut und ist ein untergäriges Schankbier mit 4,7 % Alkoholgehalt.
Es wurde lange Zeit außerhalb des Stadtteils Hemelingen von der Brauerei Haake Beck gebraut, die zu Becks & Co. gehört. Seit 2012 wird es im Hofbrauhaus Wolters in Braunschweig gebraut.
Trotzdem zählt es zu Bremens Bierspezialität und verspricht "süffig, mild und einfach gut sein". Für ein leichtes Bier am Nachmittag nach einer Wattwanderung also genau das Richtige ;)

> Hello dear friends of beer,
last week during our fall vacation, it was that time again. I have tasted a new type of beer.
We were in East Frisia on the beautiful North Sea on that day made a mudflat hike. The weather was beautiful, so we brought a picnic blanket and some snacks with us to the beach. With us was a bottle of Hemelinger spezial.
Hemelinger spezial has been brewed since 1878 and is a bottom-fermented draft beer with 4.7% alcohol content.
For a long time it was brewed outside the Hemelingen district by the Haake Beck brewery, which belongs to Becks & Co. Since 2012, it has been brewed at Hofbrauhaus Wolters in Braunschweig.
Nevertheless, it is one of Bremen's beer specialties and promises to be "quaffable, mild and simply good." So for a light beer in the afternoon after a mudflat hike just right ;)


![IMG_20221007_161324-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EqomwaLf3iFPp4Sie3EwbaJ9cRdw3zH1AXQEbzcYoehUkjyjnCWEXKidWhFQNJMpHcF.jpg)


![IMG_20221007_161436.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EoCieHYARUpmdpnMnWSCJPYPqnGFVRUkRE38Sh6pU7dUCusfM7USQNyZzNQ92wvfvxx.jpg)

---
Das Watt war ziemlich kalt, aber total schön und ich liebe diese eigene Welt dort draußen. Man ist so fernab von Allem und spürt einfach nur die Natur.
Nachdem meine Füße irgendwann richtig kalt wurden, ging ich langsam zurück an den Grünstrand. Langsam ist dabei wortwörtlich zu nehmen, da das Watt recht schlickig und rutschig war und ich mich sehr bemühte, mich nicht langzulegen ;) Und ja, es ist mir geglückt :)
Nun freute ich mich richtig auf mein Bier. Ich muss sagen, dass mir Bier draußen an der frischen Luft eigentlich immer am Besten schmeckt. 

> The mudflats were quite cold, but totally beautiful and I love this own world out there. You are so far away from everything and just feel the nature.
After my feet became really cold at some point, I slowly went back to the green beach. Slow is to be taken literally, because the mudflats were quite muddy and slippery and I tried very hard not to lie down ;) And yes, I succeeded :)
Now I was really looking forward to my beer. I must say that I beer outside in the fresh air actually always tastes best. 
---

Recht schlicht anmutend kommt es daher in seiner kleinen braunen Steini Flasche und seinem orangefarbenen Etikett.

> Quite simple looking, it comes in its small brown Steini bottle and its orange label.


![IMG_20221012_085652-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/244eAS3mqE6nBDK2t6NzyaW6XX4j861wZa3okVjc3Kk98v2kxxnavByYz8QB4nqwh1mQF.jpg)


![IMG_20221012_085637-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EortzvcBukHkwGhGVr2863pQdWWgMNgDHjCT7CgYSwetRTbqiKFyH6257sWp7rYTcg2.jpg)

---

Da ich das Bier gerne vor der Watt Kulisse fotografieren wollte, habe ich es kurzerhand auf einem Mülleimer platziert. Natürlich habe ich mir dabei ein paar komische Blicke eingefangen, aber das kann ich mittlerweile gekonnt ausblenden ;)

Since I wanted to photograph the beer with pleasure in front of the Watt scenery, I have placed it without further ado on a garbage can. Of course, I have caught a few funny looks, but I am now able to skillfully ignore that ;)

![IMG_20221012_085619-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/23v4XrBgX7cyufc8uMJ1ug45WpWWERMiA8EqktiJPs7rGyGJvYS7vJzP4dNgALRJFt6Vv.jpg)

---

![IMG_20221012_085729-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/242rnvYkJfuWaRF7NkxL4rqNMaAVitgJnKwWrSNf6o8iXwd5Sf54T6nH32mEkYeqDDu7m.jpg)


![IMG_20221012_085750-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/2449xTGA4v6WGgS4w8hw9e4ok9pVpkxfh5p5R1iPK8xduaTGizQhi2M9xapWq8UHshMc8.jpg)


![IMG_20221012_085824-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/241tWyBcXcCB6NhGrqqfYQhXM5eURPwXP8B5XnuVentYVaBXN6sXTEAaAqBRYNJoqGPQE.jpg)





![IMG_20221012_090101-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/23xyNqtj3P2hvT9xcuroygHXK9GRfBcPpmWMN9JfNaKb94wSd7qSJEwK3YggWKPSE5iq1.jpg)


![IMG_20221012_085854-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/23vPNnZzYygzTWwkcn8dcrDeSgtsUEcESPmZ1m29jiQE5eBB3Y2HBLdrFvgj7kCEyHxTw.jpg)

---


![IMG_20221012_090025-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EqfFrWLWgeLSPv55zjvPngmhGzDBqAZYFNVncMk2MJbjcYMNwbNL1C1aiDaFNCDr7pt.jpg)

---

### FAZIT:

Das Hemelinger spezial hält, was es verspricht. Es ist sehr mild und leicht und man schmeckt eine ganz leichte Malzsüße heraus. Ein perfektes Bier für einen sonnigen Nachmittag in der Natur. Es ist bekömmlich und liegt nicht schwer im Bauch. Ich denke, man könnte gut ein paar davon trinken ;) Ok, es hebt sich nicht gerade durch
außergewöhnliche Aromen ab, aber für mich ist es genau richtig so.
Wenn ich es mal wieder irgendwo entdecke, werde ich mich sicherlich mit ein paar Flaschen eindecken. 

---

### CONCLUSION: 
> Hemelinger spezial delivers what it promises. It is very mild and light and you can taste a very slight malt sweetness. A perfect beer for a sunny afternoon in nature. It is digestible and is not heavy in the stomach. I think you could easily drink a few ;) Ok, it doesn't exactly stand out with
extraordinary flavors, but for me it is just right.
If I ever discover it again somewhere, I will certainly stock up on a few bottles. 

---


Der Himmel ziegte sich an diesem Oktober nachmittag sogar noch fast wolkenlos. Was für ein Moment!


> The sky was even almost cloudless on this October afternoon.
What a moment! 

![IMG_20221012_085715-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EpxnwCRgvSaMWX53c2SHXQHqpmRnmSRweMKJqjcw9we1gg7BJ2f5DV755c9rMwRi8YE.jpg)


![IMG_20221012_085950-min.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/EnsaVEC4HeUC9wkdEfq2cRPj36gSyNi8x7qQFZ1EV6ASej2zfRJW7XzxY4cC2WKyBra.jpg)

---

Wenn auch Ihr gerne mal neue Biersorten ausprobiert, dann kommt doch in die [BEER Community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) und macht mit bei @detlev 's #BeerSaturday!

> If you also like to try new beers, then come to the [BEER Community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-187719/created) and join @detlev 's #BeerSaturday!


![Überschrift hinzufügen.jpg](https://files.peakd.com/file/peakd-hive/karizma/23ynmW5qq5QwktVNtXafwHg6NR4CBvqGxuVU5RVv9pqNt28SmYhvgDan9x85RAnBVKyzA.jpg)

She did, I sat next to her and played Splatoon 3. Without freaking out, because otherwise she would have woken up. @quekery was fully diligent and "connected". Also worked - everyone now knows what the HiQ is and who made the physical edition. LOOL Last day (Editor's note: Aka Sunday.): Sleep in. Then for the final "dinner". The food was not that good. But to see all the people for the last time was really nice. We were even able to examine Jupiter in our smocation (Editor's note: Or as we like to call it, the North Star.). In the Volkshotel we had free beer, which we didn't want to miss. However, the evening had to end sometime, because we had to get up early the next day. Or should I rather say "should have"? Because we all overslept. (Note from Drill Sergeant @quekery: Except me, but that should teach them a lesson). What a fuck. That meant rushing off. We also had weed that needed to be smoked because we couldn't have taken it with us. That meant we had to make and smoke 2 more final joints. I was so high. I've never been that high before. The tram ride to the station almost turned into chaos too. We got off one stop too early due to some weird display shit on the tram, which meant we had to walk one stop and almost missed our train. We unfortunately missed our extended goodbye ritual with @mary-me. The trip back wasn't as nice as the trip there. I had to convert my backpack into a stool to avoid sitting on the floor. Even though we were able to get a seat afterwards, however, we didn't play Splatoon 3 like we did on the outward journey. In Osnabrück @quekery and I parted ways again. That was the official end of the HiveFest. Conclusion: I would do it again. (Only without camping. I'll never do that again at a HiveFest). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) ### @mary-me My #roadtohivefest began at the airport when I was given a stern look at the security checkpoint. My first thought was, "Sh"", they found the travel grinder that still had some traces of the last trip in my carry-on bag." Then one of the security guards approached me and asked me to open my bags. He swiped at the clothes in my suitcase with a swab. All I could think was, "What is he doing?" Until he held the swab out to me and said, "Take this in your hand and swipe it over your waistband." "Whaaaat?", I thought. I gathered all my courage and asked what he was doing. The security guy looked at me with an iron face and said, "This is an explosives test." So the trip to HiveFest already had started chaotically for me and it would stay that way for the duration. I took the public transport from the airport directly to the Volkshotel, where the welcome took place and the badges and goodie bags were handed out. My eyes immediately fell on the print HiQs, which, contrary to expectations, looked exactly as I had imagined them, weeks before. Woohoo, we have completed the first quest. Full of euphoria and surrounded by more or less strangers in a city unknown to me, the evening was to end convivially. At least that was the plan. But as life often plays, the usual damper was not long in coming. Yep, my handbag was stolen on the very first evening - in the lobby of the Volkshotel. In it, besides my cell phone, were HiQ's fiat travel fund and the crypto debit card with the rest of the editorial team's and my riches. Shit happens. The incident was not to dampen our spirits, however. I cancelled all cards that same evening and the next day I filed a police report. After @smooms and I went to the police, we went to a cell phone store and I was allowed to choose a HiQ company cell phone. It was about time that the quota woman and Madame Secretary got a (Editor's note: pink) company cell phone. On the second evening, or first official evening, @quekery, @smooms and I holed up in my room/cottage (Editor's note: Because we are the Hive Blockchain's money-saving foxes, Mary wasn't allowed to treat herself to a room at the luxurious Volkshotel, but had to sleep in a small cottage at the Amsterdam campground) to write our weekly editorial post on @hiq.redaktion and go over the presentation again. The next morning, it was an early start for us, as our presentation was the first of the day. @smooms did well and his Batman t-shirt fit perfectly. (Editor's note: The choices were Duff Beer and Batman. [Note from. @mary-me: Definitely Batman. (Note from @quekery: Definitely Düff. But nobody asked me.)]) The day went by insanely fast and slowly the stress of the last days and weeks fell away. On the last day we chilled out at my accommodation during the day and in the early evening we treated ourselves to a taxi to the location where the final dinner was held. Taking a taxi was pure luxury, considering that we had cycled all the way and the weather was unfortunately not so cooperative. The last evening ended where the whole spectacle began, namely in the Volkshotel. There was a bar on an upper floor where we had a separate area with access to the terrace. (Editor's note: And the booze was included.) We fell into bed or rather the sleeping bag (LOOL) late and unfortunately had to get out very early again, but all no problem if you have a drill sergeant @quekery. All in all, it was a successful HiveFest7 despite suspicion of explosives and travel grinder panic, a stolen handbag, bad weather, generally long ways but toilet and shower within walking distance. With the chaotic pair @quekery and @smooms everything is twice as much fun and never boring. Looking forward to next year and curious on which continent, in which country, the next HiveFest will take place. Anyway, the core team of the HiQuarters 2.0 Discord server will try to be represented there as well. ★ ![](https://i.imgur.com/plMUJVK.png) [![](https://i.imgur.com/klYHwAP.png)](https://www.kicktipp.de/hive-soccer-cup/) Ad (Sponsored by @reiseamateur) ![](https://i.imgur.com/plMUJVK.png) ![](https://i.imgur.com/WPYp25C.png) ![](https://i.imgur.com/KCDVUMS.png) Ad

**"Have you heard?" - Rumour has it that things got a bit crazy at HiveFest. We were right in the middle of the action, of course. Well, @quekery most of all.** **HiQ core team has a clean slate** @smooms and @mary-me sit on a bench in the sun outside the location with @alexvan (Note from @mary-me: thanks again!) on day 2. @alexvan asks, "And you're really sleeping in a campsite?" @smooms replies, "Yeah, sure." @alexvan with a visibly worried look: "But you guys showered, right?" LOOL ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **The HiveFest is upside down** @minigunner, who was the master of the goodies stall, didn't find it so funny that @mary-me flipped some of the magazines from the HiveFest page to the HiQ page every time she passed the stall. Muhahaaa... ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Ex-Rally co-pilot on the luggage carrier** The way from the Volkshotel to the campsite turned out to be a bit difficult on the first evening. Because @mary-me came directly from the airport to the Volkshotel, she didn't have a bike yet and so @quekery and @smooms had to work out who would take her and who would take her suitcase on the respective carrier of their bike. As we already had been in a coffee shop by this point, this was no easy quest. Because just before setting off, we consumed the ████ of our lives together with @felixxx. Of course, the Amsterdam tourist of today didn't factor in the way back. @smooms was barely responsive. The next day he claimed that it was because his mind was on the theft. But he may claim a lot of things. @quekery, who took on his role as drill sergeant just at that moment, decided, in spite of the odds, that @smooms would take the suitcase (Editor's note: Which had an accident twice. Luckily it didn't happen to @mary-me.) and @quekery @mary-me. With her co-pilot skills, @mary-me was able to help us reach the campsite (Editor's note: with shower) safely. ➅ HIVESTYLE  

**In an issue that is predominantly decorated by HiveFest articles, Hivestyle must of course not be neglected. After all, our good reputation as THE Hivestyle magazine is at stake.** **Battle of Blockchains** On [Twitter](https://twitter.com/lukemwillis/status/1575945961096220672?t=iyBv7p-oASdzjjid8ytyIQ&s=19), the final round of the #BattleOfBlockchains is taking place. The final is Hive vs Proton. Only unfortunately, the voting was presumably infested by a bot army that voted in favor of Proton. Still, cool that our beloved Chain made it this far. ![](https://i.imgur.com/x5eBTzC.png) ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Lightning Proposal** If you ever wanted to donate or shop with Hive or HBD, we can only recommend [V4V](https://lnd.v4v.app/lnd) by @brianoflondon. And if you are also so excited about this possibility to pay with Hive, you might consider voting for the matching [Proposal](https://peakd.com/me/proposals/222). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **PeakD Proposal** @peakd, our favorite frontend, is planning a lot of new stuff like a Next Gen Hive Block Explorer. The special thing about this explorer is that it should be able to handle second layer transactions. While there are all transactions from second layer apps in the Hive chain, this new explorer can validate them as well. If you want to support PeakD's many projects, you can simply vote for their [Proposal](https://peakd.com/me/proposals/223). More information can be found in our HiveFest Cover Story. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **CryptoBrewMaster Proposal**. CryptoBrewMaster by @rollie1212 needs funds to develop the game further. If you want to support the project, you can vote for the [Proposal](https://peakd.com/me/proposals/235). (Editor's note: Good thing we had one vote left, LOOL). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Hive Marketing Proposal** If you want to support the [Hivefive](https://hivefive.io/) initiative, there is a [Proposal](https://peakd.com/me/proposals/232) for that as well. The proposal aims to find external developers and integrate them into the Hive ecosystem. Hivefive is a project of @behilarious. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **SPK Proposal** @spknetwork not only gave a talk at HiveFest. You can also support the project by voting for the [Proposal](https://peakd.com/me/proposals/231). 390,090 HBD will be distributed per day and probably for more than a year. And don't forget to claim your LARYNX. You can do so [here](https://spk.dlux.io/). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **BeeSharp** Have you ever been looking for a Hive library for C#, for example because you want to make a game in Unity? Then we have good news for you. [BeeSharp](https://github.com/NorisBlockchainSolutions/BeeSharp/wiki) might help. BeeSharp is from @nbs.gmbh. They are working hard on improvements and [video tutorials](/development/@nbs.gmbh/update-from-nbs) are planned. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Competition of the month** Self-promotion smells good, as we all know. @ynwa.andree had the idea in his last competition that every participant has to follow us. We can only say thank you for this smart, stylish and sexy idea. We have received a real wave of follows. If you enjoy giveaways, check out @ynwa.andree. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **WOOHOO** The WOO Alpha General Sale by @wrestorgonline starts on October 31st. Each pack will cost 2 $ and can only be purchased with WOO. So if you want to treat yourself to some packs, don't forget to unstake your WOO. More information can be found [here](https://peakd.com/hive-167922/@wrestorgonline/wrestling-organization-online-general-sale-update). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Tower Defense** You just can't get enough of pack sales? The presale of the upcoming tower defense game from Splinterlands has started. ![](https://i.imgur.com/OBkU6eZ.png) A pack costs around 8 &dollars; (Editor's note: 8000 DEC). But if you pay an additional 1 VOUCHER, you get a discount of 3000 DEC. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Web 3.0** On 27 September, there was an interesting talk with George Gilder on *Life After Google - The Fall of Big Data and the Rise of the Blockchain Economy.* You can find more information [here](https://peakd.com/blockchain/@threespeak/life-after-google-event-with-george-gilder-at-oklahoma-state-university) and the link to the livestream [here](https://channels.insideosu.com/media/1_nsy595sp). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **CROPS goes LP** A new Diesel Pool has seen the light of Engine. (Editor's note: Someone has to provide liquidity.) In the future, rewards will be added and Poolians will also get Holding Power. You can find out more [here](https://peakd.com/hive-167922/@dcrops/buying-crop-tokens-just-got-easier-swaphivecrop-lp-now-live-on-tribaldex). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **Photography** With all the PHOTO fans, it would be cool to have a community for it. @stresskiller has created something for you - the [MacroPhotography Community](https://peakd.com/c/hive-15966/created). ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) **When hardfork 26?** The date is still October 11th. EDITORIAL  

**Wir haben uns aus unserem gewohnten Umfeld (Anm. d. R.: Dem Keller. Außer @mary-me, da ists der Westflügel.) gewagt, um für euch das HiveFest zu covern. Was wir erlebten, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe.** Wie in jeder Ausgabe darf auch in dieser nicht der MVP fehlen. Doch was wäre die HiQ ohne ein wenig Selbstbeweihräucherung? Was wir für euch aus dem Ärmel geschüttelt haben, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe. Die Kolumne wurde von unserer rasenden Reporterin @kvinna, die leider nicht persönlich auf dem HiveFest sein konnte, geschrieben. Was ihre Wahrnehmung über die Reise des HiQ-Teams war, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe. Fleißig wie wir sind, haben wir natürlich jeden Vortrag Live gesehen. Was dort beredet wurde, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe. Natürlich bestand das HiveFest für uns nicht nur aus Präsentationen. Die Backgroundstories müssen natürlich auch gecovert werden. Unsere Sidequests und Erlebnisse auf dem HiveFest, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe. Wisst ihr, was ihr sonst noch in dieser Ausgabe lesen könnt? Natürlich, wie immer, Gossip, Hivestyle für Hivians und unsere allzeit beliebte Kategorie, die Leserbriefe. Was wir uns für unsere größten Fans aus dem Hut gezaubert haben, lest ihr in dieser Ausgabe. PS: Auch in dieser Ausgabe könnt ihr wieder am Commentary Discont Sale teilnehmen und bis zu 270 HIQS zum Preis von 0.3 SWAP.HIVE ergattern. Schreibt dazu >!HIQS HierDeinWuschbetrag in die Kommentare. Nach 3 Tagen werden wir unter @hiq.shares einen Post veröffentlichen, der den Sale abwickelt. PPS: **[Votet HiQs Witness. Jetzt. LOOL!](https://vote.hive.uno/@hiq.witness)** ★ ![](https://i.imgur.com/plMUJVK.png)

INHALTSVERZEICHNIS

  ➀ HiQs MVP - Print-HiQ   ➁ Kolumne - Highfhive (nur halt zu dritt) **Titelthema**   ➂ HiQs HiveFest 2022 Zusammenfassung   ➃ Moments of HiveFest 2022 **Hivestyle**   ➄ Gossip   ➅ Hivestyle für Hivians   ➆ Leserbriefe ★ ![](https://i.imgur.com/plMUJVK.png) ![](https://i.imgur.com/vFHgGWA.jpg) Von: @smooms

➀ MVP  

**Ein Monat, 2 MVPs. Doch in dieser digitalen Ausgabe stehen die Sterne wieder auf "sich auf die eigene Schulter klopfen" mit FOMO als Aszendenten. In dieser Ausgabe: Die physikalische HiQ Ausgabe des HiveFest7.** Natürlich hätten wir eine massive Auswahl an Usern gehabt, die in dieser Ausgabe zum MVP hätten gekrönt werden können. Doch auch wir müssen zusehen, dass der Rubel rollt. Wie schon im Anreißer erwähnt, handelt es sich beim MVP in dieser Ausgabe um das physikalische HiveFest Magazin selbst. **HiQ - The Hivestyle Magazine - HiveFest Issue №1**. Nahezu 3 Monate Stress, Blut, Schweiß, Tränen, Fomo, Stress, Werbepartner finden, der Druckerei auf den Sack gehen und Stress hat es uns eingebracht, doch die Ausgabe ist echt. So richtig echt. Zum Anfassen und so richtig umblättern. Ein physikalisches NFT mit einem exorbitanten Sammlerwert vielleicht? Das wird sich zeigen. Anhand des positiven Feedbacks lässt sich allerdings festmachen, dass dies nicht die letzte Ausgabe sein wird. (Anm. d. R.: Wahrscheinlich.) Auf dem HiveFest in Amsterdam haben alle Besucher mit Ticket in ihren Goodiebags eine kostenlose Ausgabe der HiQ bekommen. Jedoch wollen wir nicht den Hivians unter euch, die aus welchem Grund auch immer das HiveFest nicht besuchen konnten/wollten unser hochwertig produziertes Magazin vorenthalten. Macht euch am besten selbst ein Bild und schaut euch den Vortrag an. Proof of authority und Proof of identity incoming? ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) ### SPK Network
Im [Vortrag](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXFtDxs0Kik&t=223s) von @starkerz ging es um die neuesten Streiche vom SPK Network. Neben Encoding Nodes, welche bereits live sind, arbeitet SPK an Content Delivery Nodes und Storages Nodes. Das Speak Network soll auch Offchain Mechaniken bieten, wobei Hive dann als Indexer fungiert. Auf [d.buzz](https://d.buzz/#/) könnt ihr euch zum Beispiel jetzt schon mit Metamask einloggen. Ein weiterer Schwerpunkt des Vortrags waren Breakaway Communities. Im Prinzip handelt es sich hierbei um eine Konkurrenz zu den Outposts von Tribaldex. Breakaway Communities sind Ecency Forks mit Point System und eigenen Token. Das Besondere ist, dass Token nicht durch den Ersteller distributiert werden, sondern durch einen Pay-in. Pay-ins von Community Membern erzeugen die Liquidität der Liquidity Pools, welche SIP genannt werden. Ein dritter Aspekt war das Wrapping, welches Cross-Chain-Swapping ermöglichen soll. ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) ### Lightning strikes Hive
@brianoflondon hat einen [Vortrag](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uYzmzQXsMy4) über sein neuestes Projekt gehalten - @podping. Zu Beginn seines Vortrags ging er noch kurz auf [V4V](https://lnd.v4v.app/lnd) ein. V4V ermöglicht es, Lightning-Payments mit HIVE oder HBD zu machen, um zum Beispiel einem Podcast SATS zu donaten. Auch das Tauschen von SATS in HIVE oder HBD ist mit V4V möglich. [Podping](https://podping.org/) ist ein Tool, welches Podcasts auf Hive indexiert. Die Idee ist simpel, aber vielleicht auch bahnbrechend. Normalerweise werden Podcasts von Apple, Google oder Spotify indexiert. Das Problem dabei ist, dass sich eine zentralisierte Indexierung etabliert hat. Podping schafft allerdings Abhilfe. Das Projekt, welches mittlerweile knapp ein Jahr alt ist, lagert das Indexieren auf Hive aus. Sollten mehr Podcasts und Podcast Apps diese Variante des Indexierens benutzen, wäre Podcasting deutlich dezentraler und zensursicherer und das auch noch durch Hive. Apps wie [Podcast Index](https://podcastindex.org/stats) oder [Podverse](https://podverse.fm/de) nutzen Podping schon jetzt. Bisher wurden schon über 4 Millionen Podcasts durch Podping indexiert. Steht uns da ein neuer Standard bevor? ![](https://i.imgur.com/AJfM3KB.png) ### Rising Star
